title: Miscellanea
content:
This is the first try to create an article to show on my website by Hugo.
How can I change the order of the side-list? –> Use ‘weight’ !
I shall not change the ‘date’ casually, and be careful of ‘Drafts’, ‘Expired’ and ‘Future’.
It doesn’t support \(\LaTeX\) inherently. But I make it with the help of \(\KaTeX\). I followed this concise and beginner-friendly tutorial. $$\int_{-\infty}^{\infty}\mathrm{e}^{-x^2}\mathrm{d}x=\sqrt{\pi}$$
If I want to write html content in a markdown file, I need to set markup.goldmark.renderer.unsafe to be true. As its name implies, there can be some risk.
It is convenient to use {{ < toc-tree > }} or {{ < toc > }} to generate a table of content.

The following is a short introduction of IDAHOTB from the IDAHOTB website. The Chinese version is my unofficial translation. And because of the lack of my knowledge, if there are errors, please correct me. More information is accessible on https://may17.org. Wish a world with less discrimination and more tolerance.
This year’s theme is “Together: Resisting, supporting, healing".
WHAT IS MAY 17? The International Day Against Homophobia, Transphobia and Biphobia was created in 2004 to draw the attention to the violence and discrimination experienced by lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, intersex people and all other people with diverse sexual orientations, gender identities or expressions, and sex characteristics.
The date of May 17th was specifically chosen to commemorate the World Health Organizationâ€™s decision in 1990 to declassify homosexuality as a mental disorder.
The Day represents a major global annual landmark to draw the attention of decision makers, the media, the public, corporations, opinion leaders, local authorities, etc. to the alarming situation faced by people with diverse sexual orientations, gender identities or expressions, and sex characteristics.
May 17 is now celebrated in more than 130 countries, including 37 where same-sex acts are illegal. Thousands of initiatives, big and small, are reported throughout the planet. Even if every year a â€œglobal focus issueâ€ is promoted, the International Day Against Homophobia, Transphobia and Biphobia is not one centralised campaign; rather it is a moment that everyone can take advantage of to take action, on whatever issue and in whatever format that they wish.

title: QCQI-solutions
content:
Unofficial Solutions for QCQI Quantum computation and quantum information is a rapidly developing field, and in the last decade there has been a lot of new process and inspiration. Nevertheless, the classical textbook “Quantum Computation and Quantum Information” by Michael A. Nielsen and Issac L. Chuang is still the indispensable one for beginners and for references. Sometimes it is reputed as the Bibles in this field and owns multiple merits, one of these is its pedagogical exercises. However, there is no official solutions for the exercise, and when I started to learn it, I came across many difficulties and had never finished all a set of questions of any chapter. Therefore, I would like to push myself to go through it again, to make my time seem not so meaningless, and hopefully it can be of a little help for someone in need.
The book referred here is the 10th Anniversary Edition that is reprinted by Tsinghua University Press in China Mainland. I have found some solutions by kindly ones, and they are of great help, some are listed below:
 https://enakai00.hatenablog.com/search?q=qcqi+solution https://serab.net/docs/qcqi/ https://github.com/goropikari/SolutionQCQINielsenChuang  But neither is complete, so I would try to write a new one to fill the blank. And one should also check the Errata List.
About The author of this set of solutions is now(2021) an undergraduate student majoring in Physics and is planning to continue studying for Ph.D. in quantum computing. So no doubt there will be lots of errors and imprecision in these unofficial solutions. Please leave comments if you have any opinions and I will sincerely thank for your help.
These solutions will be updated casually.

title: Chapter 1
content:
Introduction and Overview Exercise 1.1 So long as the set of possible \(x\) is finite, only 2 times are needed to keep error probability less than 1/2.
Say \(x_0\neq x_1\in {0,…,2^{n}-1}\), $$ f(x_0)=f(x_1) \Rightarrow f\ \text{is constant,}\\ f(x_0)\ne f(x_1) \Rightarrow f\ \text{is balanced.} $$ For the second condition, no error will occur. For the first condition, error occurs when we pick two variable from the same subset with \(2^n-1\) members, so the error probabilty is $$ \epsilon=\dfrac{2^{n-1}-1}{2^n-1}=\dfrac{1}{2}-\dfrac{1}{2(2^n-1)}<\dfrac{1}{2}. $$
For a given threshold \(\epsilon\), we should require after \(k\) times evaluation, $$ 2\times\dfrac{\left( \begin{array}{c} 2^{n-1}\\ k\\ \end{array} \right)}{\left( \begin{array}{c} 2^n\\ k\\ \end{array} \right)}\le\epsilon $$ The coefficient 2 comes from that the first pick can be either value. Suppose \(n\) is very large and \(2k\ll 2^n\), we take logarithm and use Stirling’s approximation:
$$ 2^{n-1}\ln2^{n-1}-2^n\ln2^n+(2^n-k)\ln(2^n-k)-(2^{n-1}-k)\ln(2^{n-1}-k)<\ln\frac{\epsilon}{2}\\ \frac{k^2}{2^n}+k\ln2+\ln\frac{\epsilon}{2}\gtrsim0\\ k\gtrsim2^{n-1}\times(-\ln2+\sqrt{(\ln2)^2-2^{2-n}\ln\frac{\epsilon}{2}})\sim2^{n/2}\sqrt{\ln\epsilon} $$
1.2 If we have a device to distinguish \(|\psi\rangle\) and \(|\phi\rangle\) correctly, then given a state, we can use the device to figure out what the state is, and according to the result, we can (in principal) produce the same state as many as we want. Therefore, we build a cloning device for \(|\psi\rangle\) and \(|\phi\rangle\) in a identification-producing way.
If we have a clonig device, we just make as many copies as we need and measure these identical states in the basis {\(|\psi\rangle,\ |\psi^{\perp}\rangle\)}, then we can draw the conclusion because: $$ \lim_{n\rightarrow\infty}|\langle\psi|\phi\rangle|^n=0 $$ so long as they are different.
